etymologies: early 19th century: formed irregularly from system+ -ic

definitions: relating to a system, especially as opposed to a particular part

examples.text: the disease is localized rather than systemic

definitions: denoting the part of the circulatory system concerned with the transportation of oxygen to and carbon dioxide from the body in general, especially as distinct from the pulmonary part concerned with the transportation of oxygen from and carbon dioxide to the lungs.
shortDefinitions: denoting part of circulatory system concerned with transport of oxygen to and carbon dioxide from body in general

definitions: (of an insecticide, fungicide, or similar substance) entering the plant via the roots or shoots and passing through the tissues.
shortDefinitions: (of insecticide, fungicide, or similar substance) entering plant via roots or shoots and passing through tissues
